results.title: A Little life
results.creator_credit: Deborah Howlett and Vicious Circle Productions
results.brief_description: This program explores the life and death of a 19 year old Aboriginal youth who was shot while trying to escape from Canning Vale Remand centre in Perth. His death is one of 35 in Western Australia investigated by the Muirhead Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody. These facts alone cannot tell the story of Ricci Vicenti whose creativity, humour and sheer zest for life impressed everyone with whom he came in contact. This narrative documentary poses many questions about Australian society, its laws, its sense of justice, cross cultural attitudes and the experiences of Aboriginal people with the law. Ricci’s story is told by his mother and foster mother and juxtaposed with the news coverage of the time. A moving exploration of a rich but short life.

results.title: A Little joke
results.brief_description: A rift in the friendship of two girls develops when one girls tells a racist joke about the other. Lisa has a traditional Chinese dinner at the home of Nancy, her Chinese-American friend. When she returns home, her father and brother tease her about Chinese food, chopsticks and accents. Lisa repeats these jokes at school the following day and they are repeated in Nancy’s presence causing her to feel hurt. As Lisa witnesses more racial problems in the playground, she realises the impact of her ‘little joke’ and seeks out Nancy to make up.

results.title: A Link with our past
results.brief_description: There was a time when the cable car was the pride of many major cities in the Western World, but that was when the pace of life was much slower. However, when major cities started to expand, it became apparent that the demand for some form of short-haul transportation could not be ignored. A young engineer named George Smith Duncan has successfully built a cable tramway in New Zealand. He later moved to Melbourne where he would eventually build the worlds largest cable tram network.

results.title: A Life of perfection
results.brief_description: Why does a nun cut herself off from the world in the Service of God? What are the difficulties and joys of living closely together in a Convent? How do nuns try to live a “life of perfection”? In this film photographed at the Roman Catholic Convent of the Sisters of the Assumption, London, and the Anglican Community of the Sisters of the Love of God, Oxford, nuns explain their attitude to their work and the world outside.

results.title: A Letter to Amy (K)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Peter, a young African American boy, who is planning his birthday party. Shows him pondering over the invitation letter and anxiously awaiting the party day to see if she comes. Concludes with Amy arriving very late, thus making the party a happy one.

results.title: A Letter for John
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: No. 2 in the Junior Social Studies series this film shows how John, a boy who lives in Bathurst, New South Wales, receives a letter through the post from his friend Peter, who lives in Manly, Sydney, New South Wales.

results.title: A Kite story
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: A story about a boy, two kites, and a stranger who makes the kites. He gives the boy a small white kite, to which he is very attached until he sees the glittering rocket kite…The tale is adventure and fantasy, and indicates the values of friendship and loyalty.

results.title: A Kind of seeing: the colour of Scotland
results.creator_credit: Edward McConnell, Films of Scotland and IFA (Scotland)
results.brief_description: An abstract colour impression of Scotland throughout the four seasons of the year. The camera focused on flowers, the surface of ponds and the winter sky. There is no commentary, the background music was composed by Frank Spedding.

results.title: A Killing rain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Taylor, BBC-TV and United Nations Environment Programme
results.brief_description: Acid rain is one aspect of environmental pollution discussed at the Public Hearing in London in 1982. This program travels from Scotland to Scandinavia to West Germany to uncover background causes and the effects of this major pollution problem of the 80s.
